Fraternities learn about food services

The second annual Fraternity Purchasing Associations Food and Services Show was held in the HUB ballroom and fishbowl earlier this week PERIOD

The FPA a nonprofit selfsupporting organization supplies foods and various other products to  State College area fraternities as well as civic and nonprofit organizations at the lowest possible price said FPA Manager Steve Fluder PERIOD

Fluder said the food show was held to allow association members to find out more about FPAs function PERIOD

In addition he said the food exhibit also gave local State College vendors who operate some of the businesses that deal with the association a chance to display their products PERIOD

The association serves as a liaison between the fraternities and other organizations and the local vendors said Glenn Hartz student FPA chairman PERIOD

The  fraternities are FPA members PERIOD Both student and alumni fraternity members serve as chairmen for the association PERIOD

Fluder said these chairmen give recommendations and feedback to the FPA about business matters PERIOD

He said association adds a minimal fee to the costs but the fraternities still receive large savings on their purchases PERIOD

Last year the association handled . million worth of purchasing he said PERIOD The association was also able to give  back to the members of the coop PERIOD

Dan Madio the local salesman for the Weis Food Service  part of the Weis Market  said the association provides a needed function for groups such as fraternities PERIOD

 Madio said PERIOD

Because the fraternities go through the association the businesses know they will be paid Madio said PERIOD

Madio also said the businesses now deliver directly to the groups PERIOD In the past they delivered products to the FPA warehouse and the association would make the deliveries PERIOD

Fluder said the association was originally organized to service the University fraternities PERIOD

Because of the large turnover of students and personnel within the fraternities food suppliers did not want to deal with the individual houses PERIOD This was because of the possibility of not receiving payment PERIOD

In the 1960s two separate attempts were made to organize a group to deal with the fraternities food purchasing PERIOD Both attempts failed because of inadequate managing PERIOD

 Fluder said PERIOD

Fluder said  such organizations have sprung up separately around the country PERIOD The local FPA was founded at the University in  PERIOD

The oldest food coop  in existence for  years  is located at the Ohio State University PERIOD

Fluder said the nationwide cooperations met for the first time last June to discuss mutual concerns PERIOD

Fluder is the chairman for next Junes convention which will be held at the University PERIOD
